risk_description: Mobile OS background task aggression (iOS/Android) may kill the technician location tracking service, causing gaps in GPS history and real-time visibility failure.
root_cause: Modern mobile operating systems aggressively terminate background processes to conserve battery, specifically affecting long-running geolocation services.
mitigation_strategy: Implement foreground service notifications for Android and 'Always' location permissions for iOS; implement local buffering of coordinates when the socket disconnects; utilize 'significant change' location services as a fallback trigger.
contingency_plan: Fallback to a 'Check-In/Check-Out' manual location update model if continuous tracking proves unreliable on specific OEM Android devices.
monitoring_trigger: Gap in GPS coordinate timestamps exceeding 5 minutes for active technicians in 'Travel Mode'.

risk_description: High-frequency GPS write volume (TimescaleDB) combined with WebSocket broadcasting may saturate database I/O and introduce latency exceeding the <2s requirement.
root_cause: Writing every single GPS coordinate update directly to disk creates immense I/O pressure; standard relational writes cannot sustain high-throughput telemetry.
mitigation_strategy: Implement an ephemeral buffering layer (Redis) for real-time 'current location' reads; perform batch asynchronous writes to TimescaleDB for historical trace data only.
contingency_plan: Scale up the TimescaleDB instance SKU or reduce the default GPS polling frequency from 5s to 15s.
monitoring_trigger: WebSocket message latency exceeding 500ms or Database Write Queue depth > 1000 items.

risk_description: Azure AD B2C token synchronization issues with the local user database may cause authentication loops or stale role data, breaking RBAC.
root_cause: Decoupling identity management (B2C) from authorization logic (local PG database) introduces eventual consistency challenges and token claim mapping errors.
mitigation_strategy: Implement a custom B2C API Connector to push user updates to the local database via webhooks during the token issuance flow; enforce short JWT expiration times.
contingency_plan: Implement a forced 're-login' flow if the local user record version does not match the token version.
monitoring_trigger: Increase in HTTP 403 Forbidden errors for valid tokens in Application Insights.

risk_description: Offline-first data synchronization (WatermelonDB) may result in data conflicts or corruption when multiple device states reconcile with the server.
root_cause: Bi-directional sync logic is complex; identifying the 'source of truth' when a user modifies data offline while the server state changes is error-prone.
mitigation_strategy: Define strict 'Server Wins' conflict resolution policies for reference data; use append-only event logs for transactional data (e.g., Service Requests) to avoid update conflicts.
contingency_plan: Disable offline write capabilities for critical entities and revert to 'Read-Only' offline mode.
monitoring_trigger: Sync error rate > 2% in client telemetry.

risk_description: Failure to meet the <15 minute RPO target for PostgreSQL due to misconfigured Geo-Redundancy or Write-Ahead Log (WAL) lag.
root_cause: Default Azure PostgreSQL Flexible Server configurations may not automatically guarantee 15-minute RPO across regions without specific tuning of checkpointing and replication.
mitigation_strategy: Configure Azure PostgreSQL Flexible Server with Geo-Redundant backups and verify WAL replication latency metrics; implement automated PITR testing.
contingency_plan: Failover to the read-replica immediately (promote to primary) accepting potential minor data loss if primary region is fully irretrievable.

risk_description: Mapbox API integration may exceed budget or rate limits due to inefficient tile caching or excessive geocoding requests from the Super Admin dashboard.
root_cause: Interactive polygon drawing tools and technician tracking maps generate high volumes of tile and geocoding requests if not properly cached.
mitigation_strategy: Implement aggressive client-side tile caching; proxy geocoding requests through a backend service with rate limiting and response caching (Redis).
contingency_plan: Switch to Azure Maps or OpenStreetMap for non-critical map layers if Mapbox costs become unsustainable.
monitoring_trigger: Mapbox API usage reaching 80% of monthly budget tier within the first 15 days.
